scientists.name: Louis Pasteur
scientists.fact: Pasteur demonstrated microorganisms cause disease, enabling vaccination science.

scientists.name: William Harvey
scientists.fact: Harvey was the first to describe completely and in detail the systemic circulation and properties of blood being pumped to the brain and body by the heart.

scientists.name: Marie Curie
scientists.fact: Curie conducted pioneering research on radioactivity and discovered elements polonium and radium.

scientists.name: Alexander Fleming
scientists.fact: Fleming discovered the world's first broadly effective antibiotic substance, which he named penicillin.
